alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:20PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN ST. LOUIS AND NORTHERN CARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM CDT... At 219 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Floodwood, or 17 miles northeast of Big Sandy Lake, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brookston and Saginaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Minnesota.
